page.title: 03BIRDS IN MARSKE AREA.
page.content: There is a large variety of birds in and around the area of Marske. On the {moorland}:-Red Grouse, Snipe, Woodcock, Golden Plover, Curlew, Lapwing & Skylark visit. Little Owl & Hobby have been seen. Among the {Woodlands}:- Sparrowhawk, Magpie (increasing in number due to fewer gamekeepers), Woodpigeon, Tawny Owl, Great Spotted & Green Woodpecker, Coaltit & Gold Crest. Regulars of the {lower land}are:- Blackbird, Robin, Wren, Bluetit, Chaffinch, Dunnock, Sparrow, Thrush, Willow & Garden Warbler, Partridge, Pheasant (reared), Jackdaw, Rook and Carrion Crow (curse of the shepherds){Visitors}:- Cuckoo, Swallow, Swift, Kestral, Redstart, Wagtail, Fieldfare and Nuthatch. By the{Waterside}:- Heron, Dipper, Coot and Mullard.
